dataSourceConfig.description:
Configuration for creating a DATA_SOURCE sheet.

DATA_SOURCE sheets connect to external data sources like BigQuery.
The API uses addDataSource request which automatically creates the associated sheet.

IMPORTANT: Requires additional OAuth scope: bigquery.readonly

forceUnique.description: When True (default), automatically ensures the sheet name is unique by appending a numeric suffix (e.g., '_2', '_3') if the requested name already exists. This makes the action resilient to retries and parallel workflows. When False, the action fails with an error if a sheet with the same name already exists. Please provide a value of type boolean.
forceUnique.title: Forceunique

objectSheetConfig.description:
Configuration for creating an OBJECT sheet (a sheet containing a chart).

To create an OBJECT sheet, you must provide chart configuration.
The API uses addChart with position.newSheet=true to create the chart on its own sheet.

properties.description: Advanced sheet properties (grid dimensions, tab color, position, etc.). For simple cases, just use the 'title' parameter directly. Use this for additional customization.

spreadsheetId.description: REQUIRED. Cannot be empty. The ID of the target spreadsheet where the new sheet will be added. This is the long alphanumeric string in the Google Sheet URL (e.g., '1BxiMVs0XRA5nFMdKvBdBZjgmUUqptlbs74OgvE2upms'). Use 'Search Spreadsheets' action to find the spreadsheet ID by name if you don't have it. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheetId.title: Spreadsheetid

title.description: The name for the new sheet tab. Must be unique within the spreadsheet. Example: "Q3 Report", "Sales Data 2025". This is a convenience parameter - alternatively, you can set this via properties.title. Please provide a value of type string.
title.title: Title

value.description: Adds a new sheet to a spreadsheet. Supports three sheet types: GRID, OBJECT, and DATA_SOURCE. SHEET TYPES: - GRID (default): Standard spreadsheet with rows/columns. Use properties to set dimensions, tab color, etc. - OBJECT: Sheet containing a chart. Requires objectSheetConfig with chartSpec (basicChart or pieChart). - DATA_SOURCE: Sheet connected to BigQuery. Requires dataSourceConfig with bigQuery spec and bigquery.readonly OAuth scope. OTHER NOTES: - Sheet names must be unique; use forceUnique=true to auto-append suffix (_2, _3) if name exists - For tab colors, use EITHER rgbColor OR themeColor, not both - Avoid 'index' when creating sheets in parallel (causes errors) - OBJECT sheets are created via addChart with position.newSheet=true - DATA_SOURCE sheets require bigquery.readonly OAuth scope Use cases: Add standard grid sheet, create chart on dedicated sheet, connect to BigQuery data source.
value.display_description: Adds a new sheet to a spreadsheet. Supports three sheet types: GRID, OBJECT, and DATA_SOURCE. SHEET TYPES: - GRID (default): Standard spreadsheet with rows/columns. Use properties to set dimensions, tab color, etc. - OBJECT: Sheet containing a chart. Requires objectSheetConfig with chartSpec (basicChart or pieChart). - DATA_SOURCE: Sheet connected to BigQuery. Requires dataSourceConfig with bigQuery spec and bigquery.readonly OAuth scope. OTHER NOTES: - Sheet names must be unique; use forceUnique=true to auto-append suffix (_2, _3) if name exists - For tab colors, use EITHER rgbColor OR themeColor, not both - Avoid 'index' when creating sheets in parallel (causes errors) - OBJECT sheets are created via addChart with position.newSheet=true - DATA_SOURCE sheets require bigquery.readonly OAuth scope Use cases: Add standard grid sheet, create chart on dedicated sheet, connect to BigQuery data source.
value.name: googlesheets_add_sheet

case_sensitive.description: Whether the search should be case-sensitive. Please provide a value of type boolean.
case_sensitive.title: Case Sensitive

has_header_row.description: Whether the first row contains column headers. If True, column names can be used for search_column and target_column. Please provide a value of type boolean.
has_header_row.title: Has Header Row

operation.description: The mathematical operation to perform on the target column values. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
operation.title: Operation

percentage_total.description: For percentage operation, the total value to calculate percentage against. If not provided, uses sum of all values in target column. Please provide a value of type number.
percentage_total.title: Percentage Total

search_column.description: The column to search in for filtering rows. Can be a letter (e.g., 'A', 'B') or column name from header row (e.g., 'Region', 'Department'). If not provided, all rows in the target column will be aggregated without filtering. Please provide a value of type string.
search_column.title: Search Column

search_value.description: The exact value to search for in the search column. Case-sensitive by default. If not provided (or if search_column is not provided), all rows in the target column will be aggregated without filtering. Please provide a value of type string.
search_value.title: Search Value

sheet_name.description: The name of the specific sheet within the spreadsheet. Matching is case-insensitive. If no exact match is found, partial matches will be attempted (e.g., 'overview' will match 'Overview 2025'). Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
sheet_name.title: Sheet Name

spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Sheets spreadsheet. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

target_column.description: The column to aggregate data from. Can be a letter (e.g., 'C', 'D') or column name from header row (e.g., 'Sales', 'Revenue'). Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
target_column.title: Target Column

value.description: Searches for rows where a specific column matches a value and performs mathematical operations on data from another column.
value.display_description: Searches for rows where a specific column matches a value and performs mathematical operations on data from another column.
value.name: googlesheets_aggregate_column_data

dimension.description: Specifies whether to append rows or columns. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
dimension.title: Dimension

length.description: The number of rows or columns to append. Please provide a value of type integer. This parameter is required.
length.title: Length

sheet_id.description: The numeric ID of the sheet (not the sheet name). This is a non-negative integer found in the sheet's URL as the 'gid' parameter (e.g., gid=0) or in the sheet properties. The first sheet in a spreadsheet typically has sheet_id=0. Please provide a value of type integer. This parameter is required.
sheet_id.title: Sheet Id

spreadsheet_id.description: The ID of the spreadsheet. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

value.description: Tool to append new rows or columns to a sheet, increasing its size. Use when you need to add empty rows or columns to an existing sheet.
value.display_description: Tool to append new rows or columns to a sheet, increasing its size. Use when you need to add empty rows or columns to an existing sheet.
value.name: googlesheets_append_dimension

dateTimeRenderOption.description: How dates and times should be rendered in the output. SERIAL_NUMBER: Dates are returned as serial numbers (default). FORMATTED_STRING: Dates returned as formatted strings. Please provide a value of type string.
dateTimeRenderOption.title: Datetimerenderoption

empty_strings_filtered.description: Please provide a value of type boolean.
empty_strings_filtered.title: Empty Strings Filtered

ranges.description: A list of cell ranges in A1 notation from which to retrieve data. If this list is omitted, empty, or contains only empty strings, all data from the first sheet of the spreadsheet will be fetched. Empty strings in the list are automatically filtered out. Supported formats: (1) Bare sheet name like 'Sheet1' to get all data from that sheet, (2) Sheet with range like 'Sheet1!A1:B2', (3) Just cell reference like 'A1:B2' (uses first sheet). For sheet names with spaces or special characters, enclose in single quotes (e.g., "'My Sheet'" or "'My Sheet'!A1:B2"). IMPORTANT: For large sheets, always use bounded ranges with explicit row limits (e.g., 'Sheet1!A1:Z10000' instead of 'Sheet1!A:Z'). Unbounded column ranges like 'A:Z' on sheets with >10,000 rows may cause timeouts or errors. If you need all data from a large sheet, fetch in chunks of 10,000 rows at a time.
ranges.title: Ranges

spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Spreadsheet from which data will be retrieved. This is the ID found in the spreadsheet URL after /d/. You can provide either the spreadsheet ID directly or a full Google Sheets URL (the ID will be extracted automatically). Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

valueRenderOption.description: How values should be rendered in the output. FORMATTED_VALUE: Values are calculated and formatted (default). UNFORMATTED_VALUE: Values are calculated but not formatted. FORMULA: Values are not calculated; the formula is returned instead. Please provide a value of type string.
valueRenderOption.title: Valuerenderoption

value.description: Retrieves data from specified cell ranges in a Google Spreadsheet.
value.display_description: Retrieves data from specified cell ranges in a Google Spreadsheet.
value.name: googlesheets_batch_get

first_cell_location.description: The starting cell for the update range, specified in A1 notation (e.g., 'A1', 'B2'). The update will extend from this cell to the right and down, based on the provided values. If omitted or set to null, values are appended as new rows to the sheet. Note: No placeholder value is needed - simply omit this field or set it to null to trigger append mode. Please provide a value of type string.
first_cell_location.title: First Cell Location

includeValuesInResponse.description: If set to True, the response will include the updated values in the 'spreadsheet.responses[].updatedData' field. The updatedData object contains 'range' (A1 notation), 'majorDimension' (ROWS), and 'values' (2D array of the actual cell values after the update). Please provide a value of type boolean.
includeValuesInResponse.title: Includevaluesinresponse

sheet_name.description: The name of the specific sheet (tab) within the spreadsheet to update. Case-insensitive matching is supported (e.g., 'sheet1' will match 'Sheet1'). Note: Default sheet names are locale-dependent (e.g., 'Sheet1' in English, 'Foglio1' in Italian, 'Hoja 1' in Spanish, '시트1' in Korean, 'Feuille 1' in French). If you specify a common default name like 'Sheet1' and it doesn't exist, the action will automatically use the first sheet in the spreadsheet. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
sheet_name.title: Sheet Name

spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Sheets spreadsheet to be updated. Must be an alphanumeric string (with hyphens and underscores allowed) typically 44 characters long. Can be found in the spreadsheet URL between '/d/' and '/edit'. Example: 'https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1BxiMVs0XRA5nFMdKvBdBZjgmUUqptlbs74OgvE2upms/edit' has ID '1BxiMVs0XRA5nFMdKvBdBZjgmUUqptlbs74OgvE2upms'. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

valueInputOption.description: How input data should be interpreted. 'USER_ENTERED': Values are parsed as if typed by a user (e.g., strings may become numbers/dates, formulas are calculated). 'RAW': Values are stored exactly as provided without parsing (e.g., '123' stays as string, '=SUM(A1:B1)' is not calculated). Please provide a value of type string.
valueInputOption.title: Valueinputoption

values.description: A 2D array of cell values where each inner array represents a row. Values can be strings, numbers, booleans, or None/null for empty cells. Ensure columns are properly aligned across rows. This parameter is required.
values.title: Values

value.description: Write values to ONE range in a Google Sheet, or append as new rows if no start cell is given. IMPORTANT - This tool does NOT accept the Google Sheets API's native batch format: - WRONG: {"data": [{"range": "...", "values": [[...]]}], ...} - CORRECT: {"sheet_name": "...", "values": [[...]], "first_cell_location": "...", ...} To update MULTIPLE ranges, make SEPARATE CALLS to this tool for each range. Features: - Auto-expands grid for large datasets (prevents range errors) - Set first_cell_location to write at a specific position (e.g., "A1", "B5") - Omit first_cell_location to append values as new rows at the end Requirements: Target sheet must exist and spreadsheet must contain at least one worksheet.
value.display_description: Write values to ONE range in a Google Sheet, or append as new rows if no start cell is given. IMPORTANT - This tool does NOT accept the Google Sheets API's native batch format: - WRONG: {"data": [{"range": "...", "values": [[...]]}], ...} - CORRECT: {"sheet_name": "...", "values": [[...]], "first_cell_location": "...", ...} To update MULTIPLE ranges, make SEPARATE CALLS to this tool for each range. Features: - Auto-expands grid for large datasets (prevents range errors) - Set first_cell_location to write at a specific position (e.g., "A1", "B5") - Omit first_cell_location to append values as new rows at the end Requirements: Target sheet must exist and spreadsheet must contain at least one worksheet.
value.name: googlesheets_batch_update

data.description: The new values to apply to the spreadsheet. If more than one range is matched by the specified DataFilter the specified values are applied to all of those ranges. Can be provided as a JSON string or as a list of DataFilterValueRange objects. This parameter is required.
data.title: Data

includeValuesInResponse.description: Determines if the update response should include the values of the cells that were updated. By default, responses do not include the updated values. Please provide a value of type boolean.
includeValuesInResponse.title: Includevaluesinresponse

responseDateTimeRenderOption.description: Determines how dates, times, and durations in the response should be rendered. This is ignored if responseValueRenderOption is FORMATTED_VALUE. The default dateTime render option is SERIAL_NUMBER. Please provide a value of type string.
responseDateTimeRenderOption.title: Responsedatetimerenderoption

responseValueRenderOption.description: Determines how values in the response should be rendered. The default render option is FORMATTED_VALUE. Please provide a value of type string.
responseValueRenderOption.title: Responsevaluerenderoption

spreadsheetId.description: The ID of the spreadsheet to update. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheetId.title: Spreadsheetid

valueInputOption.description: How the input data should be interpreted. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
valueInputOption.title: Valueinputoption

value.description: Tool to update values in ranges matching data filters. Use when you need to update specific data in a Google Sheet based on criteria rather than fixed cell ranges.
value.display_description: Tool to update values in ranges matching data filters. Use when you need to update specific data in a Google Sheet based on criteria rather than fixed cell ranges.
value.display_name: Batch Update Values by Data Filter
value.name: googlesheets_batch_update_values_by_data_filte

sheet_id.description: The ID of the sheet on which the basic filter should be cleared. Please provide a value of type integer. This parameter is required.
sheet_id.title: Sheet Id

spreadsheet_id.description: The ID of the spreadsheet. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

value.description: Tool to clear the basic filter from a sheet. Use when you need to remove an existing basic filter from a specific sheet within a Google Spreadsheet.
value.display_description: Tool to clear the basic filter from a sheet. Use when you need to remove an existing basic filter from a specific sheet within a Google Spreadsheet.
value.name: googlesheets_clear_basic_filter

range.description: The A1 notation of the range to clear values from (e.g., 'Sheet1!A1:B2', 'MySheet!C:C', or 'A1:D5'). If the sheet name is omitted (e.g., 'A1:B2'), the operation applies to the first visible sheet. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
range.title: Range

spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Spreadsheet from which to clear values. This ID can be found in the URL of the spreadsheet. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

value.description: Clears cell content (preserving formatting and notes) from a specified A1 notation range in a Google Spreadsheet; the range must correspond to an existing sheet and cells.
value.display_description: Clears cell content (preserving formatting and notes) from a specified A1 notation range in a Google Spreadsheet; the range must correspond to an existing sheet and cells.
value.name: googlesheets_clear_values

background_blue.description: Blue component of chart background color (0.0-1.0). If not specified, uses default. Please provide a value of type number.
background_blue.title: Background Blue

background_green.description: Green component of chart background color (0.0-1.0). If not specified, uses default. Please provide a value of type number.
background_green.title: Background Green

background_red.description: Red component of chart background color (0.0-1.0). If not specified, uses default. Please provide a value of type number.
background_red.title: Background Red

chart_spec.description: Optional full ChartSpec object to send to the Google Sheets API. Use this to support ALL chart types and advanced options. Must set exactly one of: basicChart, pieChart, bubbleChart, candlestickChart, histogramChart, treemapChart, waterfallChart, orgChart, scorecardChart. See https://developers.google.com/workspace/sheets/api/reference/rest/v4/spreadsheets/charts#ChartSpec.
chart_spec.title: Chart Spec

chart_type.description: The type of chart to create. Case-insensitive. Supported types: BAR, LINE, AREA, COLUMN, SCATTER, COMBO, STEPPED_AREA (basic charts with axes), PIE (pie/donut charts), HISTOGRAM, BUBBLE, CANDLESTICK (requires 4+ data columns for low/open/close/high), TREEMAP, WATERFALL, ORG (organizational charts), SCORECARD. Each chart type uses its appropriate Google Sheets API spec structure. For advanced customization, provide chart_spec instead. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
chart_type.title: Chart Type

data_range.description: A single contiguous range of data for the chart in A1 notation (e.g., 'A1:C10' or 'Sheet1!B2:D20'). Must be a single continuous range - comma-separated multi-ranges (e.g., 'A1:A10,C1:C10') are not supported. When chart_spec is not provided, the first column is used as the domain/labels and the remaining columns as series. IMPORTANT: PIE charts require at least 2 columns - the first column for category labels (domain) and the second column for numeric values (series). Single-column ranges are not supported for PIE charts. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
data_range.title: Data Range

legend_position.description: Position of the chart legend. Options: BOTTOM_LEGEND, TOP_LEGEND, LEFT_LEGEND, RIGHT_LEGEND, NO_LEGEND. Please provide a value of type string.
legend_position.title: Legend Position

sheet_id.description: The numeric sheetId (not the sheet name/title) of the worksheet where the chart will be created. This is a unique integer identifier for the sheet within the spreadsheet. The first/default sheet typically has sheetId=0. IMPORTANT: Use 'Get Spreadsheet Info' action to retrieve valid sheetIds - look for sheets[].properties.sheetId in the response. The sheetId must exist in the target spreadsheet; using an ID from a different spreadsheet will fail. Please provide a value of type integer. This parameter is required.
sheet_id.title: Sheet Id

spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Sheets spreadsheet where the chart will be created. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

subtitle.description: Optional subtitle for the chart. Please provide a value of type string.
subtitle.title: Subtitle

title.description: Optional title for the chart. Please provide a value of type string.
title.title: Title

x_axis_title.description: Optional title for the X-axis. Please provide a value of type string.
x_axis_title.title: X Axis Title

y_axis_title.description: Optional title for the Y-axis. Please provide a value of type string.
y_axis_title.title: Y Axis Title

value.description: Create a chart in a Google Sheets spreadsheet using the specified data range and chart type. Conditional requirements: - Provide either a simple chart via chart_type + data_range (basicChart), OR supply a full chart_spec supporting all chart types. Exactly one approach should be used. - When using chart_spec, set exactly one of the union fields (basicChart | pieChart | bubbleChart | candlestickChart | histogramChart | waterfallChart | treemapChart | orgChart | scorecardChart).
value.display_description: Create a chart in a Google Sheets spreadsheet using the specified data range and chart type. Conditional requirements: - Provide either a simple chart via chart_type + data_range (basicChart), OR supply a full chart_spec supporting all chart types. Exactly one approach should be used. - When using chart_spec, set exactly one of the union fields (basicChart | pieChart | bubbleChart | candlestickChart | histogramChart | waterfallChart | treemapChart | orgChart | scorecardChart).
value.name: googlesheets_create_chart

title.description: The title for the new Google Sheet. If omitted, Google will create a spreadsheet with a default name like 'Untitled spreadsheet'. Please provide a value of type string.
title.title: Title

value.description: Creates a new Google Spreadsheet in Google Drive. If a title is provided, the spreadsheet will be created with that name. If no title is provided, Google will create a spreadsheet with a default name like 'Untitled spreadsheet'.
value.display_description: Creates a new Google Spreadsheet in Google Drive. If a title is provided, the spreadsheet will be created with that name. If no title is provided, Google will create a spreadsheet with a default name like 'Untitled spreadsheet'.
value.name: googlesheets_create_google_sheet1

inherit_from_before.description: If true, the new column inherits properties (e.g., formatting, width) from the column immediately to its left (the preceding column). If false (default), it inherits from the column immediately to its right (the succeeding column). This is ignored if there is no respective preceding or succeeding column. Please provide a value of type boolean.
inherit_from_before.title: Inherit From Before

insert_index.description: The 0-based index at which the new column will be inserted. For example, an index of 0 inserts the column before the current first column (A), and an index of 1 inserts it between the current columns A and B. Please provide a value of type integer.
insert_index.title: Insert Index

sheet_id.description: The numeric identifier of the specific sheet (tab) within the spreadsheet. Defaults to 0 (the first sheet) if neither sheet_id nor sheet_name is provided. Use GOOGLESHEETS_GET_SHEET_NAMES or GOOGLESHEETS_FIND_WORKSHEET_BY_TITLE to obtain the sheet_id from a sheet name. Please provide a value of type integer.
sheet_id.title: Sheet Id

sheet_name.description: The name (title) of the sheet/tab where the column will be added. If provided, the action will look up the sheet_id automatically. If both sheet_id and sheet_name are provided, sheet_id takes precedence. Please provide a value of type string.
sheet_name.title: Sheet Name

spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Spreadsheet where the column will be created. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

value.description: Creates a new column in a Google Spreadsheet. Specify the target sheet using sheet_id (numeric) or sheet_name (text). If neither is provided, defaults to the first sheet (sheet_id=0).
value.display_description: Creates a new column in a Google Spreadsheet. Specify the target sheet using sheet_id (numeric) or sheet_name (text). If neither is provided, defaults to the first sheet (sheet_id=0).
value.name: googlesheets_create_spreadsheet_column

inherit_from_before.description: If True, the newly inserted row will inherit formatting and properties from the row immediately preceding its insertion point. If False, it will have default formatting. Please provide a value of type boolean.
inherit_from_before.title: Inherit From Before

insert_index.description: The 0-based index at which the new row should be inserted. For example, an index of 0 inserts the row at the beginning of the sheet. If the index is greater than the current number of rows, the row is appended. Please provide a value of type integer.
insert_index.title: Insert Index

sheet_id.description: The numeric identifier of the sheet (tab) within the spreadsheet where the row will be inserted. This ID (gid) is found in the URL of the spreadsheet (e.g., '0' for the first sheet). Either sheet_id or sheet_name must be provided. Please provide a value of type integer.
sheet_id.title: Sheet Id

sheet_name.description: The human-readable name of the sheet (tab) within the spreadsheet where the row will be inserted (e.g., 'Sheet1'). Either sheet_id or sheet_name must be provided. If both are provided, sheet_id takes precedence. Please provide a value of type string.
sheet_name.title: Sheet Name

spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Spreadsheet. Can be provided as the ID (e.g., '1qpyC0XzHc_-_d824s2VfopkHh7D0jW4aXCS1D_AlGA') or as a full URL (the ID will be extracted automatically). Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

value.description: Inserts a new, empty row into a specified sheet of a Google Spreadsheet at a given index, optionally inheriting formatting from the row above.
value.display_description: Inserts a new, empty row into a specified sheet of a Google Spreadsheet at a given index, optionally inheriting formatting from the row above.
value.name: googlesheets_create_spreadsheet_row

delete_dimension_request.description: The details for the delete dimension request object.

dimension.description: The dimension to delete (ROWS or COLUMNS). Please provide a value of type string.
dimension.title: Dimension

end_index.description: The zero-based end index of the range to delete, exclusive. Must be greater than start_index and at most equal to the sheet's current row/column count. Please provide a value of type integer.
end_index.title: End Index

include_spreadsheet_in_response.description: Determines if the update response should include the spreadsheet resource. Please provide a value of type boolean.
include_spreadsheet_in_response.title: Include Spreadsheet In Response

response_include_grid_data.description: True if grid data should be returned. This parameter is ignored if a field mask was set in the request. Please provide a value of type boolean.
response_include_grid_data.title: Response Include Grid Data

response_ranges.description: Limits the ranges of cells included in the response spreadsheet.
response_ranges.title: Response Ranges

sheet_id.description: The unique numeric ID of the sheet (not the index/position). This ID is assigned by Google Sheets and does not change when sheets are reordered. Use GOOGLESHEETS_GET_SPREADSHEET_INFO to find the sheet ID, or use sheet_name instead. Either sheet_id or sheet_name must be provided. Please provide a value of type integer.
sheet_id.title: Sheet Id

sheet_name.description: The name/title of the sheet from which to delete the dimension. Using sheet_name is recommended as it's more intuitive than sheet_id. Either sheet_id or sheet_name must be provided. Please provide a value of type string.
sheet_name.title: Sheet Name

spreadsheet_id.description: The ID of the spreadsheet. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

start_index.description: The zero-based start index of the range to delete, inclusive. Must be less than end_index and within the sheet's current row/column count. Please provide a value of type integer.
start_index.title: Start Index

value.description: Tool to delete specified rows or columns from a sheet in a Google Spreadsheet. Use when you need to remove a range of rows or columns.
value.display_description: Tool to delete specified rows or columns from a sheet in a Google Spreadsheet. Use when you need to remove a range of rows or columns.
value.name: googlesheets_delete_dimension

sheet_id.description: The ID of the sheet to delete. Note: A spreadsheet must contain at least one sheet, so you cannot delete the last remaining sheet. If the sheet is of DATA_SOURCE type, the associated DataSource is also deleted. Please provide a value of type integer. This parameter is required.
sheet_id.title: Sheet Id

spreadsheetId.description: The ID of the spreadsheet from which to delete the sheet. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheetId.title: Spreadsheetid

value.description: Tool to delete a sheet (worksheet) from a spreadsheet. Use when you need to remove a specific sheet from a Google Sheet document.
value.display_description: Tool to delete a sheet (worksheet) from a spreadsheet. Use when you need to remove a specific sheet from a Google Sheet document.
value.name: googlesheets_delete_sheet

delete_method.description: For DELETE operations: 'clear' preserves row structure, 'remove_rows' shifts data up. Please provide a value of type string.
delete_method.title: Delete Method

dry_run.description: Preview changes without applying them (for write operations). Please provide a value of type boolean.
dry_run.title: Dry Run

spreadsheet_id.description: The unique alphanumeric ID of the Google Spreadsheet extracted from the URL. Format: A long string of letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores (typically 44 characters). Find it in the URL: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/{SPREADSHEET_ID}/edit. Must be a valid ID - values like 'auto' are NOT valid and will fail. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

sql.description: Complete SQL query to execute. Must begin with SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE. Use table names (sheet names) in FROM/INTO clauses, not A1 range notation. The query must include proper SQL clauses (e.g., SELECT columns FROM table, not just a column name or condition). Example: SELECT * FROM "Sheet1" WHERE A = 'value' (correct) instead of just A = 'value' (incorrect). Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
examples: UPDATE "Inventory" SET quantity = quantity - 10 WHERE sku = 'ABC123'
sql.title: Sql

value.description: Execute SQL queries against Google Sheets tables. Supports SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE operations with familiar SQL syntax. Tables are automatically detected and mapped from the spreadsheet structure.
value.display_description: Execute SQL queries against Google Sheets tables. Supports SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE operations with familiar SQL syntax. Tables are automatically detected and mapped from the spreadsheet structure.
value.name: googlesheets_execute_sql

allSheets.description: Whether to search across all sheets in the spreadsheet. Mutually exclusive with sheet_id and range parameters. Please provide a value of type boolean.
allSheets.title: Allsheets

endColumnIndex.description: The end column (0-indexed, exclusive) of the range. Column A = 0, B = 1, etc. Only used when range_sheet_id is provided without a 'range' parameter. Please provide a value of type integer.
endColumnIndex.title: Endcolumnindex

endRowIndex.description: The end row (0-indexed, exclusive) of the range. Only used when range_sheet_id is provided without a 'range' parameter. Please provide a value of type integer.
endRowIndex.title: Endrowindex

find.description: The text to find. Can be a literal string or a regular expression pattern. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
find.title: Find

matchCase.description: Whether the search should be case-sensitive. Please provide a value of type boolean.
matchCase.title: Matchcase

matchEntireCell.description: Whether to match only cells that contain the entire search term. Please provide a value of type boolean.
matchEntireCell.title: Matchentirecell

range.description: A1 notation range string to search within (e.g., 'A1:B10', 'Sheet1!A1:B10'). When using A1 notation with a sheet name, you must also provide range_sheet_id to specify the numeric sheet ID (the API requires numeric IDs). Alternatively, use the GridRange parameters (range_sheet_id with optional row/column indices) for explicit numeric control. Mutually exclusive with sheet_id and all_sheets. Please provide a value of type string.
range.title: Range

rangeSheetId.description: The numeric sheet ID for a GridRange-based search. Required when using the 'range' parameter with A1 notation. Can also be used alone or with row/column index parameters to define a specific range. Mutually exclusive with sheet_id and all_sheets. Please provide a value of type integer.
rangeSheetId.title: Rangesheetid

replace.description: The text to replace the found instances with. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
replace.title: Replace

searchByRegex.description: Whether to treat the find text as a regular expression. Please provide a value of type boolean.
searchByRegex.title: Searchbyregex

sheetId.description: The numeric ID of the sheet to search the entire sheet (e.g., 0 for the first sheet). Mutually exclusive with sheet_name, range/range_sheet_id parameters, and all_sheets. You must specify exactly one scope: either sheet_id (entire sheet), sheet_name, range/range_sheet_id (specific range), or all_sheets. Please provide a value of type integer.
sheetId.title: Sheetid

sheetName.description: The name/title of the sheet (tab) to search within (e.g., 'Sheet1', 'Sales Data'). The sheet name will be resolved to its numeric sheet ID. Mutually exclusive with sheet_id, range/range_sheet_id parameters, and all_sheets. Please provide a value of type string.
sheetName.title: Sheetname

spreadsheetId.description: The ID of the spreadsheet to update. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheetId.title: Spreadsheetid

startColumnIndex.description: The start column (0-indexed, inclusive) of the range. Column A = 0, B = 1, etc. Only used when range_sheet_id is provided without a 'range' parameter. Please provide a value of type integer.
startColumnIndex.title: Startcolumnindex

startRowIndex.description: The start row (0-indexed, inclusive) of the range. Only used when range_sheet_id is provided without a 'range' parameter. Please provide a value of type integer.
startRowIndex.title: Startrowindex

value.description: Tool to find and replace text in a Google Spreadsheet. Use when you need to fix formula errors, update values, or perform bulk text replacements across cells. Common use cases: - Fix #ERROR! cells by replacing with empty string or correct formula - Update old values with new ones across multiple cells - Fix formula references or patterns - Clean up data formatting issues
value.display_description: Tool to find and replace text in a Google Spreadsheet. Use when you need to fix formula errors, update values, or perform bulk text replacements across cells. Common use cases: - Fix #ERROR! cells by replacing with empty string or correct formula - Update old values with new ones across multiple cells - Fix formula references or patterns - Clean up data formatting issues
value.name: googlesheets_find_replace

spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Spreadsheet. This ID can be found in the spreadsheet's URL (e.g., https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/{spreadsheet_id}/edit). Must be a resolved, actual ID - not a template variable or placeholder reference. Valid IDs typically contain alphanumeric characters, hyphens, and underscores. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

worksheet_title.description: The exact, case-sensitive title of the worksheet (tab name) to find. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
worksheet_title.title: Worksheet Title

value.description: Finds a worksheet by its exact, case-sensitive title within a Google Spreadsheet; returns a boolean indicating if found and the matched worksheet's metadata when found, or None when not found.
value.display_description: Finds a worksheet by its exact, case-sensitive title within a Google Spreadsheet; returns a boolean indicating if found and the matched worksheet's metadata when found, or None when not found.
value.name: googlesheets_find_worksheet_by_title

blue.description: Blue component of the background color (0.0-1.0). Please provide a value of type number.
blue.title: Blue

bold.description: Apply bold formatting. Please provide a value of type boolean.
bold.title: Bold

end_column_index.description: OPTION 2: 0-based index of the column AFTER the last column (exclusive). Required if 'range' is not provided. Must provide ALL four index fields together. Please provide a value of type integer.
end_column_index.title: End Column Index

end_row_index.description: OPTION 2: 0-based index of the row AFTER the last row (exclusive). Required if 'range' is not provided. Must provide ALL four index fields together. Please provide a value of type integer.
end_row_index.title: End Row Index

fontSize.description: Font size in points. Please provide a value of type integer.
fontSize.title: Fontsize

green.description: Green component of the background color (0.0-1.0). Please provide a value of type number.
green.title: Green

italic.description: Apply italic formatting. Please provide a value of type boolean.
italic.title: Italic

range.description: OPTION 1: Cell range in A1 notation (RECOMMENDED). Supports: single cells ('A1', 'F9'), cell ranges ('A1:B5'), entire columns ('A', 'I:J'), entire rows ('1', '1:5'). Provide EITHER this field OR all four index fields below, not both. Please provide a value of type string.
range.title: Range

red.description: Red component of the background color (0.0-1.0). Please provide a value of type number.
red.title: Red

spreadsheet_id.description: Identifier of the Google Sheets spreadsheet. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

start_column_index.description: OPTION 2: 0-based column index (A = 0, B = 1, F = 5). Required if 'range' is not provided. Must provide ALL four index fields together. Please provide a value of type integer.
start_column_index.title: Start Column Index

start_row_index.description: OPTION 2: 0-based row index (row 1 = index 0, row 9 = index 8). Required if 'range' is not provided. Must provide ALL four index fields together. Please provide a value of type integer.
start_row_index.title: Start Row Index

strikethrough.description: Apply strikethrough formatting. Please provide a value of type boolean.
strikethrough.title: Strikethrough

underline.description: Apply underline formatting. Please provide a value of type boolean.
underline.title: Underline

worksheet_id.description: The worksheet identifier. Accepts EITHER: (1) The sheetId from the Google Sheets API (a large number like 1534097477, obtainable via GOOGLESHEETS_GET_SPREADSHEET_INFO), OR (2) The 0-based positional index of the worksheet (0 for first sheet, 1 for second, etc.). The action will first try to match by sheetId, then fall back to matching by index. Please provide a value of type integer. This parameter is required.
worksheet_id.title: Worksheet Id

value.description: Applies text and background cell formatting to a specified range in a Google Sheets worksheet.
value.display_description: Applies text and background cell formatting to a specified range in a Google Sheets worksheet.
value.name: googlesheets_format_cell

sheet_id.description: Optional filter: return rules only for the sheet with this exact numeric sheetId. If not provided, returns rules for all sheets. If both sheet_title and sheet_id are provided, sheet_id takes precedence. Please provide a value of type integer.
sheet_id.title: Sheet Id

sheet_title.description: Optional filter: return rules only for the sheet with this exact title. If not provided, returns rules for all sheets. Please provide a value of type string.
sheet_title.title: Sheet Title

spreadsheet_id.description: Unique identifier of the Google Spreadsheet, typically found in its URL. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

value.description: List conditional formatting rules for each sheet (or a selected sheet) in a normalized, easy-to-edit form. Use when you need to view, audit, or prepare to modify conditional format rules.
value.display_description: List conditional formatting rules for each sheet (or a selected sheet) in a normalized, easy-to-edit form. Use when you need to view, audit, or prepare to modify conditional format rules.
value.name: googlesheets_get_conditional_format_rules

includeEmpty.description: If true, include cells without validation rules in the output. Default is false. Please provide a value of type boolean.
includeEmpty.title: Includeempty

ranges.description: Optional list of A1 ranges to scan. If omitted, the entire sheet(s) will be scanned. WARNING: Scanning entire large sheets may be slow.
ranges.title: Ranges

sheetId.description: Optional sheet ID to filter by. If omitted, all sheets will be scanned. Please provide a value of type integer.
sheetId.title: Sheetid

sheetTitle.description: Optional sheet title to filter by. If omitted, all sheets will be scanned. Please provide a value of type string.
sheetTitle.title: Sheettitle

spreadsheetId.description: The ID of the spreadsheet to request. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheetId.title: Spreadsheetid

value.description: Tool to extract data validation rules from a Google Sheets spreadsheet. Use when you need to understand dropdown lists, allowed values, custom formulas, or other validation constraints for cells.
value.display_description: Tool to extract data validation rules from a Google Sheets spreadsheet. Use when you need to understand dropdown lists, allowed values, custom formulas, or other validation constraints for cells.
value.name: googlesheets_get_data_validation_rules

spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Spreadsheet (alphanumeric string, typically 44 characters). Extract only the ID portion from URLs - do not include leading/trailing slashes, '/edit' suffixes, query parameters, or URL fragments. From 'https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1qpyC0XzvTcKT6EISywY/edit#gid=0', use only '1qpyC0XzvTcKT6EISywY'. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

value.description: Lists all worksheet names from a specified Google Spreadsheet (which must exist), useful for discovering sheets before further operations.
value.display_description: Lists all worksheet names from a specified Google Spreadsheet (which must exist), useful for discovering sheets before further operations.
value.name: googlesheets_get_sheet_names

dataFilters.description: The DataFilters used to select which ranges to retrieve. Supports A1 notation (e.g., 'Sheet1!A1:B2'), developer metadata lookup, or grid range filters. If empty or omitted, returns full spreadsheet metadata. Recommended: Use GOOGLESHEETS_GET_SPREADSHEET_INFO for unfiltered retrieval as it is the dedicated action for that purpose.
dataFilters.title: Datafilters

excludeTablesInBandedRanges.description: True if tables should be excluded in the banded ranges. False if not set. Please provide a value of type boolean.
excludeTablesInBandedRanges.title: Excludetablesinbandedranges

includeGridData.description: True if grid data should be returned. Ignored if a field mask is set. Please provide a value of type boolean.
includeGridData.title: Includegriddata

spreadsheetId.description: The ID of the spreadsheet to request. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheetId.title: Spreadsheetid

value.description: Returns the spreadsheet at the given ID, filtered by the specified data filters. Use this tool when you need to retrieve specific subsets of data from a Google Sheet based on criteria like A1 notation, developer metadata, or grid ranges. Important: This action is designed for filtered data retrieval. While it accepts empty filters and returns full metadata in that case, GOOGLESHEETS_GET_SPREADSHEET_INFO is the recommended action for unfiltered spreadsheet retrieval.
value.display_description: Returns the spreadsheet at the given ID, filtered by the specified data filters. Use this tool when you need to retrieve specific subsets of data from a Google Sheet based on criteria like A1 notation, developer metadata, or grid ranges. Important: This action is designed for filtered data retrieval. While it accepts empty filters and returns full metadata in that case, GOOGLESHEETS_GET_SPREADSHEET_INFO is the recommended action for unfiltered spreadsheet retrieval.
value.name: googlesheets_get_spreadsheet_by_data_filter

spreadsheet_id.description: Required. The Google Sheets spreadsheet ID or full URL. Accepts either the ID alone (e.g., '1BxiMVs0XRA5nFMdKvBdBZjgmUUqptlbs74OgvE2upms') or a full Google Sheets URL (e.g., 'https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1BxiMVs0XRA5nFMdKvBdBZjgmUUqptlbs74OgvE2upms/edit'). The ID will be automatically extracted from URLs. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

value.description: Retrieves comprehensive metadata for a Google Spreadsheet using its ID, excluding cell data.
value.display_description: Retrieves comprehensive metadata for a Google Spreadsheet using its ID, excluding cell data.
value.name: googlesheets_get_spreadsheet_info

sample_size.description: Number of rows to sample for type inference. Please provide a value of type integer.
sample_size.title: Sample Size

sheet_name.description: Sheet/tab name if table_name is ambiguous across multiple sheets. Please provide a value of type string.
sheet_name.title: Sheet Name

spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Spreadsheet. Must be a valid Google Sheets ID (typically a 44-character alphanumeric string). Do NOT use 'auto' - only 'table_name' supports auto-detection. You can get this ID from the spreadsheet URL or from SEARCH_SPREADSHEETS action. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

table_name.description: Table name from LIST_TABLES response OR the visible Google Sheets tab name (e.g., 'Sales Data', 'Projections'). Use 'auto' to analyze the largest/most prominent table. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
table_name.title: Table Name

value.description: This action is used to get the schema of a table in a Google Spreadsheet, call this action to get the schema of a table in a spreadsheet BEFORE YOU QUERY THE TABLE. Analyze table structure and infer column names, types, and constraints. Uses statistical analysis of sample data to determine the most likely data type for each column. Call this action after calling the LIST_TABLES action to get the schema of a table in a spreadsheet.
value.display_description: This action is used to get the schema of a table in a Google Spreadsheet, call this action to get the schema of a table in a spreadsheet BEFORE YOU QUERY THE TABLE. Analyze table structure and infer column names, types, and constraints. Uses statistical analysis of sample data to determine the most likely data type for each column. Call this action after calling the LIST_TABLES action to get the schema of a table in a spreadsheet.
value.name: googlesheets_get_table_schema

include_spreadsheet_in_response.description: True if the updated spreadsheet should be included in the response. Please provide a value of type boolean.
include_spreadsheet_in_response.title: Include Spreadsheet In Response

insert_dimension.description: The details for the insert dimension request. This parameter is required.

response_include_grid_data.description: True if grid data should be included in the response (if includeSpreadsheetInResponse is true). Please provide a value of type boolean.

response_ranges.description: Limits the ranges of the spreadsheet to include in the response.

spreadsheet_id.description: The ID of the spreadsheet to update. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.

value.description: Tool to insert new rows or columns into a sheet at a specified location. Use when you need to add empty rows or columns within an existing Google Sheet.

min_columns.description: Minimum number of columns to consider a valid table. Please provide a value of type integer.
min_columns.title: Min Columns

min_confidence.description: Minimum confidence score (0.0-1.0) to consider a valid table. Please provide a value of type number.
min_confidence.title: Min Confidence

min_rows.description: Minimum number of data rows to consider a valid table. Please provide a value of type integer.
min_rows.title: Min Rows

spreadsheet_id.description: The actual Google Spreadsheet ID (not a placeholder). Find it in the spreadsheet URL: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/{SPREADSHEET_ID}/edit. It is the alphanumeric string between '/d/' and '/edit' (e.g., '1BxiMVs0XRA5nFMdKvBdBZjgmUUqptlbs74OgvE2upms'). Do NOT pass template placeholders like '{{spreadsheet_id}}', '<spreadsheet_id>', or 'your-spreadsheet-id-here'. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

value.description: This action is used to list all tables in a Google Spreadsheet, call this action to get the list of tables in a spreadsheet. Discover all tables in a Google Spreadsheet by analyzing sheet structure and detecting data patterns. Uses heuristic analysis to find header rows, data boundaries, and table structures.
value.display_description: This action is used to list all tables in a Google Spreadsheet, call this action to get the list of tables in a spreadsheet. Discover all tables in a Google Spreadsheet by analyzing sheet structure and detecting data patterns. Uses heuristic analysis to find header rows, data boundaries, and table structures.
value.name: googlesheets_list_tables

case_sensitive.description: If `True`, the query string search is case-sensitive. Please provide a value of type boolean.
case_sensitive.title: Case Sensitive

normalize_whitespace.description: If `True`, strips leading and trailing whitespace from cell values before matching. This helps match cells like ' TOTAL ' or 'TOTAL ' when searching for 'TOTAL'. Please provide a value of type boolean.
normalize_whitespace.title: Normalize Whitespace

query.description: Exact text value to find; matches the entire content of a cell in a row. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
query.title: Query

range.description: A1 notation range to search within. Supports cell ranges (e.g., 'Sheet1!A1:D5'), column-only ranges (e.g., 'Sheet1!A:Z'), and row-only ranges (e.g., 'Sheet1!1:1'). Defaults to the first sheet if omitted. IMPORTANT: Sheet names with spaces must be single-quoted (e.g., "'My Sheet'!A1:Z"). Bare sheet names without ranges (e.g., 'Sheet1') are not supported - always specify a range. Please provide a value of type string.
range.title: Range

spreadsheet_id.description: Identifier of the Google Spreadsheet to search. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

value.description: Finds the first row in a Google Spreadsheet where a cell's entire content exactly matches the query string, searching within a specified A1 notation range or the first sheet by default.
value.display_description: Finds the first row in a Google Spreadsheet where a cell's entire content exactly matches the query string, searching within a specified A1 notation range or the first sheet by default.
value.name: googlesheets_lookup_spreadsheet_row

index.description: Zero-based index for the operation. Required for UPDATE, DELETE, MOVE. Optional for ADD (defaults to end of list). Please provide a value of type integer.
index.title: Index

new_index.description: Destination index for MOVE operation. Required when operation is MOVE. Please provide a value of type integer.
new_index.title: New Index

operation.description: Operation type: ADD (add new rule), UPDATE (replace rule), DELETE (remove rule), MOVE (change rule order/index). Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
operation.title: Operation

sheet_id.description: The unique numeric identifier of the sheet/tab to modify (NOT a zero-based index). This is a specific ID assigned by Google Sheets when the sheet is created, not the position of the sheet. You MUST first call GOOGLESHEETS_GET_SPREADSHEET_INFO to retrieve the actual sheetId values from the 'sheets' array in the response. Common mistake: Do not assume sheet_id=0 exists - while some spreadsheets may have a sheet with ID 0, many do not. Please provide a value of type integer. This parameter is required.
sheet_id.title: Sheet Id

spreadsheet_id.description: The ID of the spreadsheet containing the sheet to modify. Found in the Google Sheets URL between '/d/' and '/edit'. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

value.description: Add, update, delete, or reorder conditional format rules on a Google Sheet. Use when you need to create, modify, or remove conditional formatting without manually building batchUpdate requests. Supports four operations: ADD (create new rule), UPDATE (replace existing rule), DELETE (remove rule), MOVE (reorder rules by changing index).
value.display_description: Add, update, delete, or reorder conditional format rules on a Google Sheet. Use when you need to create, modify, or remove conditional formatting without manually building batchUpdate requests. Supports four operations: ADD (create new rule), UPDATE (replace existing rule), DELETE (remove rule), MOVE (reorder rules by changing index).
value.name: googlesheets_mutate_conditional_format_rules

include_formulas.description: Whether to return formula text instead of calculated values for formula columns. Please provide a value of type boolean.
include_formulas.title: Include Formulas

spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of a native Google Sheets file. Found in the spreadsheet URL after /d/ (e.g., '1BxiMVs0XRA5nFMdKvBdBZjgmUUqptlbs74OgvE2upms'). Only native Google Sheets files (MIME type: application/vnd.google-apps.spreadsheet) are supported. Files uploaded to Google Drive that are not native Google Sheets (such as Excel .xlsx files, PDFs, or Google Docs) will not work even if they can be viewed in Google Sheets. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

sql.description: SQL SELECT query. The table name is the Google Sheets tab/sheet name (visible at the bottom of the spreadsheet). Use GOOGLESHEETS_LIST_TABLES to discover available table names if unknown. Supported: SELECT cols FROM table WHERE conditions ORDER BY col LIMIT n. Table names must be quoted with double quotes if they contain spaces or are numeric-only (e.g., SELECT * FROM "My Sheet" or SELECT * FROM "415"). Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
examples: SELECT project, totals FROM "Sales_Data" WHERE totals > 10.0 ORDER BY totals DESC
SELECT name, email FROM "Customers" WHERE status = 'ACTIVE'
sql.title: Sql

value.description: Execute SQL-like SELECT queries against Google Spreadsheet tables. Table names correspond to sheet/tab names visible at the bottom of the spreadsheet. Use GOOGLESHEETS_LIST_TABLES first to discover available table names if unknown. Supports WHERE conditions, ORDER BY, LIMIT clauses.
value.display_description: Execute SQL-like SELECT queries against Google Spreadsheet tables. Table names correspond to sheet/tab names visible at the bottom of the spreadsheet. Use GOOGLESHEETS_LIST_TABLES first to discover available table names if unknown. Supports WHERE conditions, ORDER BY, LIMIT clauses.
value.name: googlesheets_query_table

dataFilters.description: The data filters describing the criteria used to determine which DeveloperMetadata entries to return. This parameter is required.

spreadsheetId.description: The ID of the spreadsheet to retrieve metadata from. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheetId.title: Spreadsheetid

value.description: Tool to search for developer metadata in a spreadsheet. Use when you need to find specific metadata entries based on filters.
value.display_description: Tool to search for developer metadata in a spreadsheet. Use when you need to find specific metadata entries based on filters.
value.name: googlesheets_search_developer_metadata

created_after.description: Return spreadsheets created after this date. Use RFC 3339 format like '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z'. Please provide a value of type string.
created_after.title: Created After

include_shared_drives.description: Whether to include spreadsheets from shared drives you have access to. Defaults to True. Please provide a value of type boolean.
include_shared_drives.title: Include Shared Drives

include_trashed.description: Whether to include spreadsheets in trash. Defaults to False. Please provide a value of type boolean.
include_trashed.title: Include Trashed

max_results.description: Maximum number of spreadsheets to return (1-1000). Defaults to 10. Please provide a value of type integer.
max_results.title: Max Results

modified_after.description: Return spreadsheets modified after this date. Use RFC 3339 format like '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z'. Please provide a value of type string.
modified_after.title: Modified After

order_by.description: Order results by field. Common options: 'modifiedTime desc', 'modifiedTime asc', 'name', 'createdTime desc'. Please provide a value of type string.
order_by.title: Order By

query.description: Search query to filter spreadsheets. Behavior depends on the 'search_type' parameter. For advanced searches, use Google Drive query syntax with fields like 'name contains', 'fullText contains', or boolean filters like 'sharedWithMe = true'. DO NOT use spreadsheet IDs as search terms. Leave empty to get all spreadsheets. Please provide a value of type string.
query.title: Query

search_type.description: How to search: 'name' searches filenames (recommended for finding specific files), 'content' searches inside spreadsheet content, 'both' searches both name and content. Note: 'name' search only matches from the START of filenames (prefix matching). For example, searching 'Budget' finds 'Budget 2024' but NOT 'Q1 Budget'. If you need substring matching in filenames, use 'both' which also searches content. Please provide a value of type string.
search_type.title: Search Type

shared_with_me.description: Whether to return only spreadsheets shared with the current user. Defaults to False. Please provide a value of type boolean.
shared_with_me.title: Shared With Me

starred_only.description: Whether to return only starred spreadsheets. Defaults to False. Please provide a value of type boolean.
starred_only.title: Starred Only

value.description: Search for Google Spreadsheets using various filters including name, content, date ranges, and more.
value.display_description: Search for Google Spreadsheets using various filters including name, content, date ranges, and more.
value.name: googlesheets_search_spreadsheets

filter.description: The filter to set. This parameter is required.

spreadsheetId.description: The ID of the spreadsheet. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheetId.title: Spreadsheetid

value.description: Tool to set a basic filter on a sheet in a Google Spreadsheet. Use when you need to filter or sort data within a specific range on a sheet.
value.display_description: Tool to set a basic filter on a sheet in a Google Spreadsheet. Use when you need to filter or sort data within a specific range on a sheet.
value.name: googlesheets_set_basic_filter

end_column_index.description: Ending column index (0-based, exclusive) for the validation range. To apply to column A only, use start_column_index=0 and end_column_index=1. Please provide a value of type integer. This parameter is required.
end_column_index.title: End Column Index

end_row_index.description: Ending row index (0-based, exclusive) for the validation range. To apply to row 1 only, use start_row_index=0 and end_row_index=1. Please provide a value of type integer. This parameter is required.
end_row_index.title: End Row Index

formula.description: Custom formula for validation. Required when validation_type='CUSTOM_FORMULA'. Formula should evaluate to TRUE/FALSE. Example: '=A1>10'. Please provide a value of type string.
formula.title: Formula

input_message.description: Optional message shown to the user when they select the cell. Helpful hint about what values are expected. Please provide a value of type string.
input_message.title: Input Message

mode.description: Operation mode: 'SET' applies a validation rule to the range, 'CLEAR' removes any existing validation from the range. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
mode.title: Mode

sheet_id.description: The unique sheet ID (numeric identifier) where the validation rule will be applied. The first sheet created in a spreadsheet typically has ID 0, while additional sheets get unique IDs (e.g., 1534097477). If a sheet is deleted, its ID is never reused - so if the original first sheet (ID 0) was deleted, attempting to use 0 will fail. Always verify the actual sheet ID exists using GOOGLESHEETS_GET_SPREADSHEET_INFO action (check 'sheets[].properties.sheetId' field). Please provide a value of type integer. This parameter is required.
sheet_id.title: Sheet Id

show_custom_ui.description: Whether to show a dropdown UI for list-based validation. Default is true. Set to true for dropdown lists. Please provide a value of type boolean.
show_custom_ui.title: Show Custom Ui

source_range_a1.description: Source range in A1 notation for dropdown values. Required when validation_type='ONE_OF_RANGE'. Example: 'Sheet1!A1:A10' or 'A1:A10'. Please provide a value of type string.
source_range_a1.title: Source Range A1

spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Sheets spreadsheet. Can be found in the spreadsheet URL between '/d/' and '/edit'. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

start_column_index.description: Starting column index (0-based, inclusive) for the validation range. Column A is index 0. Please provide a value of type integer. This parameter is required.
start_column_index.title: Start Column Index

start_row_index.description: Starting row index (0-based, inclusive) for the validation range. Row 1 is index 0. Please provide a value of type integer. This parameter is required.
start_row_index.title: Start Row Index

strict.description: Whether to reject invalid data (true) or show a warning (false). Default is true. Please provide a value of type boolean.
strict.title: Strict

validation_type.description: Type of validation rule to apply. Required when mode='SET'. 'ONE_OF_LIST': dropdown from list of values. 'ONE_OF_RANGE': dropdown from range. 'CUSTOM_FORMULA': custom formula validation. Please provide a value of type string.
validation_type.title: Validation Type

values.description: List of allowed values for dropdown. Required when validation_type='ONE_OF_LIST'. Each item becomes a dropdown option.
values.title: Values

value.description: Tool to set or clear data validation rules (including dropdowns) on a range in Google Sheets. Use when you need to apply dropdown lists, range-based dropdowns, or custom formula validation to cells.
value.display_description: Tool to set or clear data validation rules (including dropdowns) on a range in Google Sheets. Use when you need to apply dropdown lists, range-based dropdowns, or custom formula validation to cells.
value.name: googlesheets_set_data_validation_rule

sheet_json.description: A list of dictionaries representing the rows of the sheet. Each dictionary must have the same set of keys, which will form the header row. Values can be strings, numbers, booleans, or null (represented as empty cells). An empty list [] is allowed and will create a spreadsheet with an empty worksheet. This parameter is required.
sheet_json.title: Sheet Json

sheet_name.description: The name for the first worksheet within the newly created spreadsheet. This name will appear as a tab at the bottom of the sheet. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.

title.description: The desired title for the new Google Spreadsheet. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
title.title: Title

value.description: Creates a new Google Spreadsheet and populates its first worksheet from `sheet_json`. When data is provided, the first item's keys establish the headers. An empty list creates an empty worksheet.
value.display_description: Creates a new Google Spreadsheet and populates its first worksheet from `sheet_json`. When data is provided, the first item's keys establish the headers. An empty list creates an empty worksheet.

destination_spreadsheet_id.description: The ID of the spreadsheet to copy the sheet to. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.

sheet_id.description: The ID of the sheet to copy. Please provide a value of type integer. This parameter is required.
sheet_id.title: Sheet Id

spreadsheet_id.description: The ID of the spreadsheet containing the sheet to copy. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

value.description: Tool to copy a single sheet from a spreadsheet to another spreadsheet. Use when you need to duplicate a sheet into a different spreadsheet.
value.display_description: Tool to copy a single sheet from a spreadsheet to another spreadsheet. Use when you need to duplicate a sheet into a different spreadsheet.
value.name: googlesheets_spreadsheets_sheets_copy_to

includeValuesInResponse.description: Determines if the update response should include the values of the cells that were appended. By default, responses do not include the updated values. Please provide a value of type boolean.

insertDataOption.description: How the input data should be inserted. Please provide a value of type string.
insertDataOption.title: Insertdataoption

majorDimension.description: How to interpret the 2D values array. Use ROWS for row-wise data (most common for appends). Use COLUMNS for column-wise data. Example: if A1=1,B1=2,A2=3,B2=4 then majorDimension=ROWS yields [[1,2],[3,4]] and majorDimension=COLUMNS yields [[1,3],[2,4]]. Please provide a value of type string.
majorDimension.title: Majordimension

range.description: A1 notation range used to locate a logical table. New rows are appended after the last row of that table within this range. Valid formats include: sheet name only (e.g., 'Sheet1'), column range (e.g., 'Sheet1!A:D'), or cell range (e.g., 'Sheet1!A1:D100'). Sheet names with spaces are automatically quoted (e.g., 'Hoja 1!A:E' is handled correctly). The sheet name must exist in the spreadsheet; a non-existent sheet name will cause an 'Unable to parse range' error. Check updates.updatedRange in the response for where values were written. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
range.title: Range

responseDateTimeRenderOption.description: Determines how dates, times, and durations in the response should be rendered. This is ignored if responseValueRenderOption is FORMATTED_VALUE. The default dateTime render option is SERIAL_NUMBER. Please provide a value of type string.
responseDateTimeRenderOption.title: Responsedatetimerenderoption

responseValueRenderOption.description: Determines how values in the response should be rendered. The default render option is FORMATTED_VALUE. Please provide a value of type string.
responseValueRenderOption.title: Responsevaluerenderoption

spreadsheetId.description: The actual ID of the spreadsheet to update (e.g., '1BxiMVs0XRA5nFMdKvBdBZjgmUUqptlbs74OgvE2upms'). Must be a resolved value, not a variable reference like '$CALL_RESULT_1.data.spreadsheetId'. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.

valueInputOption.description: How the input data should be interpreted. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.

values.description: 2D array of values to append. Typically, each inner list is a ROW (majorDimension=ROWS). Use null/None for empty cells. This parameter is required.

ranges.description: The ranges to clear, in A1 notation (e.g., 'Sheet1!A1:B2') or R1C1 notation. Each range should be a clean string without surrounding brackets or extra quotes. Valid examples: 'Sheet1!A1:B2', 'A1:Z100', 'Sheet1'. Invalid examples: "['Sheet1!A1:B2']", '[Sheet1!A1]'. This parameter is required.

spreadsheet_id.description: The ID of the spreadsheet to update. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.

value.description: Tool to clear one or more ranges of values from a spreadsheet. Use when you need to remove data from specific cells or ranges while keeping formatting and other properties intact.

Ranges matching any of the specified data filters will be cleared. Only values are cleared -- all other properties of the cell (such as formatting, data validation, etc..) are kept.

Must be provided as a list, e.g., [{'a1Range': 'Sheet1!A1:B5'}]. A single filter object will be automatically wrapped in a list. This parameter is required.

majorDimension.description: The major dimension that results should use. For example, if the spreadsheet data is: A1=1,B1=2,A2=3,B2=4, then a request that selects that range and sets majorDimension=ROWS returns [[1,2],[3,4]], whereas a request that sets majorDimension=COLUMNS returns [[1,3],[2,4]]. Please provide a value of type string.

This is the unique identifier found in the spreadsheet URL (e.g., in 'https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/SPREADSHEET_ID/edit', the ID is the SPREADSHEET_ID part). Typical Google Sheets IDs are approximately 44 characters long and contain alphanumeric characters, hyphens, and underscores. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.

updateSheetProperties.description: The details of the sheet properties to update. This parameter is required.

value.display_description: Tool to update properties of a sheet (worksheet) within a Google Spreadsheet, such as its title, index, visibility, tab color, or grid properties. Use this when you need to modify the metadata or appearance of a specific sheet.

fields.description: The fields that should be updated. Provide a comma-separated list of field paths (e.g., 'title,locale,autoRecalc'). The root 'properties' is implied. NOTE: Wildcard '*' may not be accepted by the API for this endpoint - use explicit field names. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.

properties.description: The properties to update. At least one field within properties must be set. This parameter is required.

value.display_description: Tool to update properties of a spreadsheet, such as its title, locale, or auto-recalculation settings. Use when you need to modify the overall configuration of a Google Sheet.

headers.description: List of column names for the data. These will be matched against sheet headers. If a column doesn't exist in the sheet, it will be added automatically. Order doesn't need to match sheet order. Can be auto-derived from the first row in 'rows' if not provided. Example inputs: ['Email', 'Phone', 'Status'] for contact updates, ['Lead ID', 'Name', 'Score'] for CRM, ['SKU', 'Stock', 'Price'] for inventory.
headers.title: Headers

keyColumn.description: The column NAME (header text) to use as unique identifier for matching rows. Must be an actual header name from the sheet (e.g., 'Email', 'Lead ID', 'SKU'), NOT a column letter (e.g., 'A', 'B', 'C'). If you provide a column letter like 'A', it will be automatically converted to the header name at that column position. If neither 'key_column' nor 'key_column_index' is provided, defaults to the first column (index 0). Please provide a value of type string.
keyColumn.title: Keycolumn

key_column_index.description: The 0-based column index to use as unique identifier for matching rows. Alternative to 'key_column' - will be converted to column name using headers. If neither 'key_column' nor 'key_column_index' is provided, defaults to 0 (first column). Example: 0 for first column, 1 for second column.
key_column_index.title: Key Column Index

normalization_message.description: Internal field to track input normalization (e.g., row truncation). Not part of API. Please provide a value of type string.
normalization_message.title: Normalization Message

rows.description: 2D array of data rows to upsert. IMPORTANT: If 'headers' is NOT provided, the FIRST row is treated as column headers and remaining rows as data - so you need at least 2 rows (1 header + 1 data). If 'headers' IS provided separately, then ALL rows in this array are treated as data rows. Each row should have the same number of values as headers. If a row has MORE values than headers: with strict_mode=true (default), an error is returned showing which rows are affected; with strict_mode=false, extra values are silently truncated. If a row has FEWER values than headers, an error is returned during execution. Cell values can be strings, numbers, booleans, or null. Example with headers provided: headers=['Email','Status'], rows=[['john@ex.com','Active']] (1 data row). Example without headers: rows=[['Email','Status'],['john@ex.com','Active']] (row 1 = headers, row 2 = data). This parameter is required.
rows.title: Rows

sheetName.description: The name of the sheet/tab within the spreadsheet. Note: Google Sheets creates default sheets with localized names based on account language (e.g., 'Sheet1' for English, '工作表1' for Chinese, 'Hoja1' for Spanish, 'Feuille1' for French, 'Planilha1' for Portuguese, 'Лист1' for Russian). If you specify a common default name and the sheet is not found, the action will automatically use the first sheet if only one exists. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
sheetName.title: Sheetname

spreadsheetId.description: The ID of the spreadsheet. Must be a non-empty string, typically a 44-character alphanumeric string found in the spreadsheet URL. Please provide a value of type string. This parameter is required.
spreadsheetId.title: Spreadsheetid

strictMode.description: Controls how rows with mismatched column counts are handled. When True (default), an error is returned if any row has more values than headers - the error message shows exactly which rows are affected and what values would need to be removed. When False, extra values are silently truncated to match the header count. Set to False only if you explicitly want automatic truncation of extra values. Please provide a value of type boolean.
strictMode.title: Strictmode

tableStart.description: Cell where the table starts (where headers are located). Defaults to 'A1'. Use this if your table is offset (e.g., 'C5', 'D10'). Please provide a value of type string.
tableStart.title: Tablestart

value.description: Upsert rows - update existing rows by key, append new ones. Automatically handles column mapping and partial updates. Use for: CRM syncs (match Lead ID), transaction imports (match Transaction ID), inventory updates (match SKU), calendar syncs (match Event ID). Features: - Auto-adds missing columns to sheet - Partial column updates (only update Phone + Status, preserve other columns) - Column order doesn't matter (auto-maps by header name) - Prevents duplicates by matching key column Example inputs: - Contact update: keyColumn='Email', headers=['Email','Phone','Status'], data=[['john@ex.com','555-0101','Active']] - Inventory sync: keyColumn='SKU', headers=['SKU','Stock','Price'], data=[['WIDGET-001',50,9.99],['GADGET-002',30,19.99]] - CRM lead update: keyColumn='Lead ID', headers=['Lead ID','Score','Status'], data=[['L-12345',85,'Hot']] - Partial update: keyColumn='Email', headers=['Email','Phone'] (only updates Phone, preserves Name/Address/etc)
value.display_description: Upsert rows - update existing rows by key, append new ones. Automatically handles column mapping and partial updates. Use for: CRM syncs (match Lead ID), transaction imports (match Transaction ID), inventory updates (match SKU), calendar syncs (match Event ID). Features: - Auto-adds missing columns to sheet - Partial column updates (only update Phone + Status, preserve other columns) - Column order doesn't matter (auto-maps by header name) - Prevents duplicates by matching key column Example inputs: - Contact update: keyColumn='Email', headers=['Email','Phone','Status'], data=[['john@ex.com','555-0101','Active']] - Inventory sync: keyColumn='SKU', headers=['SKU','Stock','Price'], data=[['WIDGET-001',50,9.99],['GADGET-002',30,19.99]] - CRM lead update: keyColumn='Lead ID', headers=['Lead ID','Score','Status'], data=[['L-12345',85,'Hot']] - Partial update: keyColumn='Email', headers=['Email','Phone'] (only updates Phone, preserves Name/Address/etc)
